title: Possibly an extraneous " breaking &attributes() feature
body:
I learnt about the as-yet-undocumented feature [`&attributes`](https://github.com/visionmedia/jade/issues/664#issuecomment-32261710) earlier today and when trying to implement it came across a weird bug:

```
/usr/local/lib/node_modules/jade/lib/runtime.js:202
  throw err;
        ^
SyntaxError: src/apps/webapp/index.jade:383
    381|             script(src='app.js?v=' + version)
    382|             != '<![endif]>'
  > 383| 

Unexpected string
    at Function (<anonymous>)
    at Object.Compiler.bufferExpression (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/jade/lib/compiler.js:133:14)
    at Object.Compiler.visitAttributes (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/jade/lib/compiler.js:603:12)
    at Object.Compiler.visitTag (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/jade/lib/compiler.js:433:12)
    at Object.Compiler.visitNode (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/jade/lib/compiler.js:206:37)
    at Object.Compiler.visit (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/jade/lib/compiler.js:193:10)
    at Object.Compiler.visitBlock (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/jade/lib/compiler.js:274:12)
    at Object.Compiler.visitNode (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/jade/lib/compiler.js:206:37)
    at Object.Compiler.visit (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/jade/lib/compiler.js:193:10)
    at Object.Compiler.visitMixin (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/jade/lib/compiler.js:379:12)
```

After figuring out what source it was trying to compile:

``` javascript
jade.attr("href", 'main.css?v=' + version, true, true)
jade.attrs(jade.merge([{"data-indicator": (typeof (jade.interp = indicator) == "string" ? jade.escape(jade.interp) : jade.interp)","data-metric": (typeof (jade.interp = metric) == "string" ? jade.escape(jade.interp) : jade.interp)","class": "col"},filters]), true)
```

There are two extra `"` characters there, both after `jade.interp)`. Looking around a little more I saw that line 671 of [this file](https://github.com/visionmedia/jade/blob/2ab7df2fbbd71e599351bdd2f983476e1135a4cf/lib/compiler.js#L671) contains what appears to be an extraneous `"` character.

I really am not familiar enough with the jade internals to know if it is intentional enough or not, so I modified my local copy and the bug went away. I then ran the tests and they all passed.

I'm 1) not sure if this is an intended character and 2) not sure enough of the jade internals to make a pull request, so I hope you'll be able to let me know if this is intended.
